name: Kepler-232
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-232 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-232 is a star with 0.9019999999999999 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.97 times its radius. It is located 4575.84 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-232 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-232 b

Kepler-232 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 4.43 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-232.

The mass of Kepler-232 b is 14.34 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-232 b is 3.08 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-232 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.

Kepler-232 c

Kepler-232 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.10 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 11.38 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-232.

The mass of Kepler-232 c is 24.20 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-232 c is 3.83 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-232 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-232, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
